meanings.definition: The act of docking a ship at a wharf.
meanings.sent1: The wharfing of the large cargo ship was a smooth operation.
meanings.sent2: The wharfing of the fishing boats at the harbor happens every morning.
meanings.sent3: The wharfing of the pirate ship drew a crowd of curious onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The wharfing of the cruise liner was like a graceful dance on the water.
meanings.sent5: The wharfing of the sailboat under the sunset sky was a picturesque sight.

meanings.definition: The process of constructing or repairing a wharf.
meanings.sent1: The wharfing of the new pier took several weeks to complete.
meanings.sent2: The wharfing of the damaged dock required skilled workers.
meanings.sent3: The wharfing of the boardwalk involved hammering and sawing sounds.
meanings.sent4: The wharfing of the wooden planks echoed through the harbor.
meanings.sent5: The wharfing of the concrete structure was a noisy but satisfying task.

meanings.definition: The area along a waterfront where ships can dock.
meanings.sent1: The wharfing along the riverfront was bustling with activity.
meanings.sent2: The wharfing near the lighthouse provided a scenic view.
meanings.sent3: The wharfing by the marina was a popular spot for tourists.
meanings.sent4: The wharfing by the old warehouses had a historic charm.
meanings.sent5: The wharfing by the seaside town was a hub of maritime trade.
